title: How to Make Violet Tea

steps.headline: Select violets.
steps.description: If you grow your own, pick the violets after the dew has dried but before the sun's heat has had a chance to dry the essential oil of the violets (try mid-morning).

steps.headline: Clean violets gently.
steps.description: Shake off any dirt and insects. Place in a colander or tea strainer and gently wash the violets to remove any traces of dirt etc. Use absorbent paper to dry the violets after washing.

steps.headline: Choose whether you wish to make fresh violet tea immediately, or whether you want to make dried violet tea for later.
steps.description: Or maybe both! The flavor will be stronger in the dried version.

steps.headline: Make Fresh Violet Tea:
steps.description:
Steep fresh violets directly to make tea. Add 2-3 teaspoons fresh violet flowers to 1 cup of boiling water. If making a teapot, add as many flowers as cups to be made. text:
Select violets. If you grow your own, pick the violets after the dew has dried but before the sun's heat has had a chance to dry the essential oil of the violets (try mid-morning). Clean violets gently. Shake off any dirt and insects. Place in a colander or tea strainer and gently wash the violets to remove any traces of dirt etc. Use absorbent paper to dry the violets after washing. Choose whether you wish to make fresh violet tea immediately, or whether you want to make dried violet tea for later. Or maybe both! The flavor will be stronger in the dried version.
